speaker: LAFEW
text: Do you hear, monsieur? A word with you.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Your pleasure, sir.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Your lord and master did well to make his

speaker: LAFEW
text: recantation.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: “Recantation”? My “lord”? My “master”?

speaker: LAFEW
text: Ay. Is it not a language I speak?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: A most harsh one, and not to be understood

speaker: PAROLLES
text: without bloody succeeding. My “master”?

speaker: LAFEW
text: Are you companion to the Count Rossillion?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: To any count, to all counts, to what is man.

speaker: LAFEW
text: To what is count’s man. Count’s master is of

speaker: LAFEW
text: another style.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: You are too old, sir; let it satisfy you, you are

speaker: PAROLLES
text: too old.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I must tell thee, sirrah, I write man, to which

speaker: LAFEW
text: title age cannot bring thee.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: What I dare too well do, I dare not do.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I did think thee, for two ordinaries, to be a

speaker: LAFEW
text: pretty wise fellow; thou didst make tolerable vent

speaker: LAFEW
text: of thy travel; it might pass. Yet the scarves and the

speaker: LAFEW
text: bannerets about thee did manifoldly dissuade me

speaker: LAFEW
text: from believing thee a vessel of too great a burden.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I have now found thee. When I lose thee again, I

speaker: LAFEW
text: care not. Yet art thou good for nothing but taking

speaker: LAFEW
text: up, and that thou ’rt scarce worth.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Hadst thou not the privilege of antiquity

speaker: PAROLLES
text: upon thee—

speaker: LAFEW
text: Do not plunge thyself too far in anger lest thou

speaker: LAFEW
text: hasten thy trial, which if—Lord have mercy on

speaker: LAFEW
text: thee for a hen! So, my good window of lattice, fare

speaker: LAFEW
text: thee well; thy casement I need not open, for I look

speaker: LAFEW
text: through thee. Give me thy hand.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My lord, you give me most egregious

speaker: PAROLLES
text: indignity.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Ay, with all my heart, and thou art worthy of it.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I have not, my lord, deserved it.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Yes, good faith, ev’ry dram of it, and I will not

speaker: LAFEW
text: bate thee a scruple.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Well, I shall be wiser.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Ev’n as soon as thou canst, for thou hast to

speaker: LAFEW
text: pull at a smack o’ th’ contrary. If ever thou be’st

speaker: LAFEW
text: bound in thy scarf and beaten, thou shalt find

speaker: LAFEW
text: what it is to be proud of thy bondage. I have a

speaker: LAFEW
text: desire to hold my acquaintance with thee, or

speaker: LAFEW
text: rather my knowledge, that I may say in the default

speaker: LAFEW
text: “He is a man I know.”

speaker: PAROLLES
text: My lord, you do me most insupportable

speaker: PAROLLES
text: vexation.

speaker: LAFEW
text: I would it were hell pains for thy sake, and my

speaker: LAFEW
text: poor doing eternal; for doing I am past, as I will by

speaker: LAFEW
text: thee in what motion age will give me leave.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Well, thou hast a son shall take this disgrace

speaker: PAROLLES
text: off me. Scurvy, old, filthy, scurvy lord! Well, I must

speaker: PAROLLES
text: be patient; there is no fettering of authority. I’ll

speaker: PAROLLES
text: beat him, by my life, if I can meet him with any

speaker: PAROLLES
text: convenience, an he were double and double a lord.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I’ll have no more pity of his age than I would have

speaker: PAROLLES
text: of—I’ll beat him, an if I could but meet him again.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Sirrah, your lord and master’s married. There’s

speaker: LAFEW
text: news for you: you have a new mistress.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: I most unfeignedly beseech your Lordship

speaker: PAROLLES
text: to make some reservation of your wrongs. He is

speaker: PAROLLES
text: my good lord; whom I serve above is my master.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Who? God?

speaker: PAROLLES
text: Ay, sir.

speaker: LAFEW
text: The devil it is that’s thy master. Why dost thou

speaker: LAFEW
text: garter up thy arms o’ this fashion? Dost make hose

speaker: LAFEW
text: of thy sleeves? Do other servants so? Thou wert

speaker: LAFEW
text: best set thy lower part where thy nose stands. By

speaker: LAFEW
text: mine honor, if I were but two hours younger, I’d

speaker: LAFEW
text: beat thee. Methink’st thou art a general offense,

speaker: LAFEW
text: and every man should beat thee. I think thou wast

speaker: LAFEW
text: created for men to breathe themselves upon thee.

speaker: PAROLLES
text: This is hard and undeserved measure, my

speaker: PAROLLES
text: lord.

speaker: LAFEW
text: Go to, sir. You were beaten in Italy for picking a

speaker: LAFEW
text: kernel out of a pomegranate. You are a vagabond,

speaker: LAFEW
text: and no true traveler. You are more saucy with

speaker: LAFEW
text: lords and honorable personages than the commission

speaker: LAFEW
text: of your birth and virtue gives you heraldry.

speaker: LAFEW
text: You are not worth another word; else I’d call you

speaker: LAFEW
text: knave. I leave you.
